channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024030104
item.description:
Report X-2024030104

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WEARING PROPER PPE, RESPONDER USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE ROLLER LINE. BOX WAS WET ON BOTTOM CORNER NO LIQUID ON THE ROLLER LINE OR ON FLOOR. NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1 .X-2024030029 RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR HAZMAT LEAKER. ARRIVED IN PROPER PPE WITH DECISION TREE IN HAND. AFTER LOOKING AT HAZMAT, RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE FOR PROPER CLEAN UP. WHEN CLEANING WAS DONE, TAKEN TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCEDURE. 2. X-2024030030 RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR HAZMAT LEAKER. ARRIVED IN PROPER PPE WITH DECISION TREE IN HAND. AFTER LOOKING AT HAZMATE, RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE FOR PROPER CLEAN UP. WHEN CLEANING WAS DONE, TAKEN TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCEDURE.

item.title: Report X-2024021916
item.description:
Report X-2024021916

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE HANDLING AN AIR PACKAGE WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. THE PACKAGE HANDLER ALSO NOTICED THE SOUND OF DRY ICE PELLETS MOVING INSIDE THE BOX. RESPONDER INSPECTED AND FOUND APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING FOOD. THE OUTER BOX IS PREPRINTED PERISHABLE AND FRAGILE WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM PA USING UPS ACCOUNT 853E2X, CHOANIES BAKERY, 605 HAZEL ST, LEBANON PA 17042. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK.

item.title: Report X-2024021751
item.description:
Report X-2024021751

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 5 liter plastic bottles of medivators rapicide pa high level disinfectant part A and part B one 5 liter plastic bottle of part A was leaking from the top of the cap allowing .50 liters to release. package did have a inner box containing the 2 x 5 liter plastic bottles of part A but no other slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaitng disposition. DescribePack: one 5 liter plastic bottle was leaking from the top of the cap allowing .50 liters to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: PITTSTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered by package handlers unloading trailer. the package was loaded on floor and was properly faced. They noticed liquid on top of the jerrican and alerted their manager to a potential leak. Manager alerted QA, and they retrieved the package. There was no significant leakage. DescribePack: a small hole in the top of the jerrican DurationRel: 167 and MitigateEffect: Manager alerted QA and the package was placed in a properly lined Hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2024021621
item.description:
Report X-2024021621

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A THREE DAY SELECT AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO THE RATTLING SOUND OF AEROSOL CANS COMING FROM THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION WE FOUND THREE AEROSOL CANS OF ARM HAMMER DEODORIZING AIR FRESHENERS. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM MICHIGAN USING UPS ACCOUNT 2F49F2, [PII REDACTED] SAN FRANCISCO CA 94107. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024020628
item.description:
Report E-2024020628

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an area of the concrete floor and estimated that one (1) cup of material was released due to one (1) 270-gallon damaged poly tote. First Call Environmental personnel transferred the remaining product to a new poly tote and shredded the damaged poly tote and containerized it into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024021861
item.description:
Report X-2024021861

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet package was found in trailer #539712 already damaged wet upon inspection of inner contents 2 x 1 gallon metal cans of mold release 225 one 1 gallon metal can had a loose cap allowing .50 gallons to release each can was in a plastic bag with molded foam on top and bottom no other slotted partitions or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one 1 gallon metal can of mold release 225 had a loose cap allowing .50 gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report E-2024030066
item.description:
Report E-2024030066

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: West Chester
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a pail that had leaked the majority of it's contents. No direct action was observed that contributed to this failure but the container was definitely punctured by some unknown object that contributed to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured pail.
